intro: Sideritis hirsuta subsp. maritima, commonly known as the coastal sidereal, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
